title: Effects of monetary policy shocks on exchange rate: Evidence from Australia
text:
Abstract. This research proposal aim to examine the exchange rate reactions to monetary policy shocks in Australia from 1980 to 2022 using the Bayesian Structural Vector Auto-regression (SVAR) model.
Keywords. R, Monetary policy, exchange rate, SVAR model

title: Effects of monetary policy shocks on exchange rate: Evidence from Australia
research plan
text:
State the objective of your research project in one sentence.

Effects of monetary policy shocks on exchange rate: Evidence from Australia

State the question that you are going to answer in another sentence.

This research proposal aim to examine the exchange rate reactions to monetary policy shocks in Australia from 2010 to 2020 using the Bayesian Structural Vector Auto-regression (SVAR) model.

Key words: Monetary policy, exchange rate, SVAR model, Delayed Overshooting

title: research plan

Introduction

Motivate your objective and research question by explaining why it is important to investigate this problem in one brief paragraph.

title: research plan
text:
Data

ERA Monthly nominal average exchange rate AUD/USD –RBA
FR Foreign exchange reserve,Official reserve assets,monthly (FX)–RBA
CPI Consumer price index, seasonally adjusted(quarterly) –ABS
PPI Producer Price Index (PPI, Quarter)–ABS
MB Monetary base, seasonally adjusted (M1) –RBA
R short-term interest rate,Bank Accepted Bills/Negotiable Certificates of Deposit-3 months; monthly average –RBA
Real GDP (quarterly) Gross domestic product: Chain volume measures ;–RBA

Notes:
–3 monthly variable all take the last value in the quarter to change to quarterly data
–data need to take Logarithm We take the logarithm of consumer price index, industrial production, foreign exchange reserves, monetary base, and exchange rates, and then multiply those series by 100.
–summary statistics
–testing autocorrelation, ADF test ???–all non-stationary??
–need to be same order of stationary

Investigate its properties and argue on: why they are essential to answer your research question, how they inform or motivate your model equations.

1~6 are endogenous variable, 3~6 are key monetary variables to identify monetary shocks, 1~2 are key variable for this study
